description: legion +â€Ž -ary. From Latin legionarius. Doublet of legionnaire.

entries.meaning: Relating to, or consisting of, a legion or legions.

examples: Unto whom (what is deplorable in men and Christians) too many applying themselves, betwixt jest and earnest, betray the cause of truth, and insensibly make up the legionary body of error.

entries.meaning: (military, Ancient Rome) A soldier belonging to a legion; a professional soldier of the ancient Roman army.
A person who is neither a citizen nor colonial/imperial subject of the state whose military they join.
A member of a legion, such as the American Legion, or of any organization containing the term legion in its title (e.g. the French Foreign Legion).
